alert.note: Alert for Portage; Summit (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 7:15AM EDT until July 29 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Portage and Summit. * WHEN...Until 915 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 715 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Akron, Ravenna, Cuyahoga Falls, Kent, Barberton, Green, Solon, Hudson, Twinsburg, Tallmadge, Streetsboro, Macedonia, Mogadore, Garrettsville, Mantua, Stow, Broadview Heights, Aurora, New Franklin and Brecksville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
